page.title: 10NEWHALL FARM / HORTICULTURE
page.content:
{NEWHALL FARM,}with 230 acres, has 120 Friesians. These are milked twice daily, supplying Express Dairies with 1700 litres of milk per day. The cattle graze outside for most of the year, but in winter are stall-fed on hay, barley and grass nuts. There are six full-time workers, with extra help at hay-making time.
{MARKET GARDENS}in Meols are sited on rich, drained soils. Most of the glass houses shown on the O.S. map have been demolished; only 3 remain to bring on young plants from seed. Flower growing was important from 1930 to 1960; now only outdoor vegetables are grown, eg potatoes, cabbages, cauliflowers, leeks, sprouts, radishes and parsley.
